comment: Prof Edwards is awesome! I was dreading this class going into it but he actually made it enjoyable. A lot of Extra Credit opportunities. The tests are hard so beware. You have discussions after seeing mandatory plays, they are graded tough but fair. The quizzes are straight from the book. Overall, an A or B is easy to achieve. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

He is  very enthusiastic about theater. If you don't really care much about theater, his tests will take you forever! They are usually 50 questions, online. Most of the questions are hidden in the textbook. There's always a quiz once a week. He assign's essay's and grades them critically. He gives plenty of extra credit opportunities. Nice guy.

I really liked his class. His lectures are interesting. Quizzes are easy. I barely read the book. If you want to do well on tests, take notes in class. His tests are based on lectures and his quizzes are from the book. You have to see play, but that's no big deal. Overall easy and glad I took it! Attendance mandatory for some classes towards end.

He likes to talk, the course material is easy to grasp. Make sure you have free time to see the plays he assigns. There is a really dumb group play where you don't get to pick your group so be prepared to work with a group that may not give a crap.

Make sure you just follow the syllabus. Professor Edwards likes to talk a lot but its an easy class. Take notes when he's giving lectures during class because thats what the test consist of and do the extra credit.

Very Enthusiastic and with a passion for acting. Gave great constructive criticism after acting assignments. Daily written assignment is due though and required more writing for this class than my English class. I hated the warmups at the beginning of the class, they for the most part seemed ridiculous.
Incredibly helpful. Passionate about his line of work, really knows his stuff. His awesome sense of humor doesn't hurt either.

An "A" in this class was effortless, but I didn't care for his frequent comments about attractive young female students. (He's 50-plus.) I didn't think he was a very good teacher either - he never finished a lecture because he would ramble on about the most unimportant topics and he never picked up next class with the rest of the material.

Edwards' class is pretty easy. There are 3 performances that you have to attend, quizzes and tests are online and there is a big group project. He also offers many extra credit opportunities. He can be a little harsh on grading papers at times though.

I have no interest in theatre, but took this class because it worked best with my schedule. To my surprise, this turned out to be one of my favorite classes and teachers. He explains things well, has a good sense of humor, and respectful of others. I went to class, paid attention and got an A. He is quick to respond to email and eager to help.
Real easy teacher. I have to agree that he doesnt grade your papers fairly, and he does make fun of your opinion. But overall his class is very easy.

I got over a 100 in this class. He offers LOADS of extra credit so if you don't get an A it is ENTIRELY your fault. You don't have to go to class on non-group days. Relies ALOT on the Georgia VIEW Vista. All tests and quizzes are online. SO easy.
